medical_history.chief_complaint: Abdominal pain and bright red blood per rectum (BRBPR) for 2 days.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient reports crampy lower abdominal pain that began 2 days ago, along with the passage of several large blood clots and bright red blood on toilet paper. Symptoms have been persistent without diarrhea, vomiting, nausea, dizziness, or lightheadedness. No factors specified that have aggravated or relieved the symptoms.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Bilateral pulmonary embolisms (PEs), history of choledocholithiasis with sphincterotomy and stenting, ovarian cyst removal, appendectomy.
medical_history.family_history: Father with colon cancer, mother with cerebrovascular accident (CVA), brother with macroglobulinemia and CNS lymphoma.
